timeline.title: Tau Sigma Delta Founded
timeline.body: A group of Ohio University men founded Tau Sigma Delta, a local fraternity, laying the groundwork for what would become Pi Kappa Alpha's Gamma Omicron chapter.

timeline.title: Gamma Omicron Chartered
timeline.body: Tau Sigma Delta was formally installed as Gamma Omicron chapter of Pi Kappa Alpha International Fraternity, joining one of America's most prestigious Greek organizations.

timeline.title: Chapter Closes
timeline.body: Social and political turmoil of the era, coupled with declining rush numbers, forced the chapter to close. The 8 Church Street house was vacated after 44 years of history.

timeline.title: Gamma Omicron Refounded
timeline.body: Dedicated alumni rallied to re-establish the chapter. After earning colony recognition, Gamma Omicron was rechartered and moved to 12 N College St.

timeline.title: Growth & Excellence
timeline.body: The refounded chapter earned multiple Smythe Trophies and established itself as a leading organization at Ohio University.
